name: Le logis de Charlotte
description: Charlotte's home is a concept of historic, unique, family home and ideal in the heart of Old Quebec for a short stay. We are a family with young children who live in a large historic house behind the famous Castle Frontenac. On the ground floor, the house has a spacious unit called Charlotte's House, in tribute to the first owner occupier of the house. Our listing is legal! Certificate of Establishment Tourisme Québec #303132.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of Old Quebec, behind the Château Frontenac and with a view of the St. Lawrence River. The quadrilateral around our house is particularly quiet for Old Quebec. Families and local residents live all around the house.
host_about: Nous sommes une famille de quatre (Nico, Farrah, BBB et Momo).

name: Comfy loft Downtown Quebec City
description:
Visit Quebec City and stay in a Chic Loft in one of the city's hippest neighborhoods. Walking access to Old Quebec, the Plains and museums .
Visit Quebec and stay in a Chic and trendy loft. Perfectly situated downtown Quebec, you can walk major touristic attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
The St-Roch district has experienced a bubbling dynamism over the past decade. A working-class and industrial district of the early 20th century, it has now become a dynamic centre for technological and cultural enterprises such as Beenox and Ubisoft. It attracts artists and young people who want to live a relaxed urban lifestyle. We find everything to satisfy the bobos of this world: barista cafe, trendy restaurants, shops of all kinds.
You can walk to the city's tourist areas such as Old Quebec and the Plains of Abraham.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | Par Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA302
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: Les Lofts de la Barricade - BA101
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

name: Old Quebec 1 BR apt & private patio (long-term)
description: ***32 days and more minimum rental*** In the heart of the Old Town,  you will stay in a lovely one bed room apartment with fully equipped kitchen, a living room & a private terrasse at only 450 meters from the Chateau Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: Old Quebec City (Vieux Québec) is a designated UNESCO World Heritage Site. As the only city in North America north of Mexico City to have preserved its walled ramparts, Quebec offers a glimpse of what living in a fortified city several centuries ago looked like. The Upper Town is built into a cliff that offers expansive views of the mighty Saint-Lawrence River, and you can wander the cobblestoned streets of the Quartier Petit-Champlain, lined with cafés and boutiques, as well as explore the surrounding historic convents, churches, and monuments.
host_about: J'adore voyager, tellement que c'est devenu mon métier!

neighborhood_overview:
Dominated by the majestic silhouette of the Parliament hotel and embellished with a splendid fountain, the Parliament Hill exudes the presence. Find out what there is to see and do in this elegant area of Old Quebec.
The area of the Parliament Hill is located in Haute-Ville, just before crossing the fortifications. It includes many government buildings, the famous Plains of Abraham as well as the lively part of Grande Allée.
The Parc des Champs-de-Bataille, which includes the Plains of Abraham, was created in 1908 for the 300th anniversary of Quebec City. This is the first national historic park in Canada.

It was on the Plains of Abraham that the famous battle of the plains took place, during which a part of the history of Quebec City and even North America took place. The Battle of 1759 was a historic move between French and British companies for power in Quebec City. The two armies were again face-to-face a few months later during the Battle of Sainte-Foy. The di

name: Beau logement à deux pas du Vieux-Québec
description: Comfortable and modern. Within walking distance to Old Quebec, the neighborhood where you will stay is lively and festive. Saint-Jean Street is a superb commercial street where restaurants, cafes and bars are numerous. If you want to live with the locals and see how the people of Quebec live, you are in the best neighborhood: the Faubourg St-Jean.
neighborhood_overview:
Centre Ville de Québec is divided into three main sectors:
1. Basse-Ville (center city). That said, if you're renting a home in this area, you'll be going up into town for the duration of your stay.
2. The old fortifications which are located in Haute-Ville. This is the neighborhood everyone is going to visit. At first, the fortifications were for protection from the English, now it's to keep tourists inside;) Anyway, this area is super beautiful, you'll love it. On the other hand, it is mainly for tourism. Here you can buy an "I LOVE QUÉBEC" t-shirt.
3. The faubourg St-Jean-Baptiste which is right next to the fortifications. This neighborhood is mine and soon yours. Even if you don't choose my place, I highly recommend this neighborhood. neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

neighborhood_overview:
The accomodation is located in the Montcalm district of Quebec City.

Stroll through the atypical streets of the Montcalm district to discover all its hidden treasures. From the Côte d'Abraham to René-Lévesque Boulevard, from Salaberry Street to Honoré-Mercier Avenue, the unique senses and the coastlines form a small green and pretty maze. Its stairs, colours, narrow houses and skylights make the SJB neighbourhood a picture worthy of the greatest movies.

At every street corner, turning your eyes towards Lowertown can lead you to discover breathtaking sunsets whose colours stretch far out over the Laurentians. However, its historical and natural charm is not the only thing that characterizes it: the merchants and artisans who live here have created a neighbourhood life that is enjoyed by all. Montcalm is a relaxed neighbourhood with trendy bars, gourmet pubs, brasseries and cafés located along its main street, Saint-Jean Street. You will find all the shops you

neighborhood_overview:
Check our website out for more information to help you plan your stay in our beautiful city!

Our apartments are located in downtown Quebec City, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec at 1.3km and visit the typical places such as the Vieux Port, the Petit Champlain, museums, Château Frontenac ... Many restaurants, coffee shops and bars are also available to discover the local gastronomy in a near distance, mainly on St-Joseph street! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Plaines of Abraham or Carrée d’Youville for skating or head to the Terrasse Dufferin to try the longest slide in North America. You will be near the Café Maëlstrom and the Ninna Pizza restaurant, the Intermarché and a local pharmacy.

TO VISIT NEAR BY…

Château Frontenac
Terrasse Dufferin
Plaines of Abraham (great for a pic-nic)
Parlement
Citadelle
Musée national des beaux-art

neighborhood_overview:
''What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go! In summer, rue Saint-Joseph converts into a pedestrian-only street every weekend.
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you! ''

Source: Destination Québec Cité / St-Roch neighbourhood

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

Sao.

name: Studio Saint-Roch
description:
License - (314830) - Discover beautiful Quebec. An apartment converted into a large loft with superb kitchen for your comfort and space in the heart of downtown. Bienvenue à tous.
Discover the beautiful city of Quebec and its charming Old-Quebec. An old shop of antique dealer RENOVATES into large loft with a superb kitchen for your comfort and your space in the middle of the Downtown area. Welcome everybody.
neighborhood_overview:
The Saint-Roch neighbourhood is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Quebec City. A constantly buzzing neighborhood combining media technology and cultural life with its trendy Rue Saint-Joseph (libraries, theatres, theatre, shops and very friendly restaurants and bars), all to make your stay as pleasant as possible.
We are located in Saint Roch's district, one of the oldest districts of Quebec. A district in constant effervescence where get married technologies-media and cultural life to its very trendy street named Saint Joseph (Libraries(Bookcases), theaters, shops, restaurants and very nice bars,), everything you need to make your stay really pleasant.
host_about:
Nous sommes un couple mixte et nous vivons à Québec. Nous aimons la vie sous toutes ses formes : bien manger, boire, dormir, flâner, écouter de la musique et beaucoup bricoler et partager. 
Pour nous le contact est primordial, il nous nourrit. Rencontrer du monde de partout et leur offrir notre univers est ce que nous avons de plus précieux et c'est pourquoi nous sommes ici. 

We are a mixed couple and we live in Quebec City. We love life in all its forms: eating well, drinking, sleeping, strolling, listening to music, tinkering and sharing.
For us the contact is primordial, it nourishes us. To meet people from all over the world and to offer them our universe is what we have most precious and that is why we are on this platform.

name: SPACIOUS APARTMENT FOR TWO -  CITÉ-LIMOILOU (A04)
description:
Are you looking for a more spacious apartment for such an affordable price? Click on our logo to see all our properties and choose the ones that suit you best!

Renovated, spacious, and bright apartment located in Quebec City. It is equipped for 2 people (1 Queensize bed) and is ideal for couples, business travelers, or solos. Wifi, Nespresso machine, dishwasher, TV are included. Sheets and towels will also be provided to ensure you spend a great stay!
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located north of Quebec, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec and visit the typical places: the Old Port, the Champlain district, museums ... Many bars and restaurants are also available to discover the local gastronomy! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Pointe-aux-Lièvres winter sports site or go skating at Carrée d'Youville! You will be near the Louis Marchand et Compagnie bakery, the Rochon grocery store and a pharmacy.

To visit :
- The National Museum of Fine Arts of Quebec.
- The Citadel of Quebec.
- The Place Royale.

To feed yourself :
- The Italian restaurant Battuto (with reservation only)
- The Nina Pizza restaurant
- The restaurant La Cuisine
- The gourmet restaurant Chez Boulay - Bistro Boréal

To do :
- Enjoy the Plains of Abraham park.
- Discover the district of Old Queb

En réservant avec le 77 St-Vallier, vous bénéficierez d'offres exclusives conçues par nos merveilleux partenaires pour nos clients! Un lien vous sera transmis après la confirmation de réservation et vous pouvez visitez notre site internet pour les découvrir.

The loft is located in the Montcalm district of Quebec City.

Stroll through the unusual streets of the Montcalm district to discover all its hidden treasures. From the Côte d 'Abraham to Boulevard René-Lévesque, from Salaberry Street to Avenue Honoré-Mercier, the unique senses and the coasts form a small green and coquettish labyrinth. Its stairs, its colors, its narrow houses and its dormers make the SJB district a painting worthy of the greatest films.

On every street corner, turning your gaze to the Lower Town can make us discover breathtaking sunsets, whose colors stretch far and wide over the Laurentians. However, its historical and natural charm is not the only element that characterizes it: the traders and craftsmen who live there have created a neighborhood life that makes everyone happy. name: QBEDS Amazing location! Private Queen Ensuite
description:
THE BEST HOSTEL IN TOWN!

QBEDS Hostel is ideally located on Grande-Allée street, which is undoubtedly the most popular street in Quebec City! You can find various bars, cafes and restaurants on Grande-Allee street, in the heart of downtown Quebec City. Its unique funky design and vibe will definitely make you feel like home! We have everything you have always dreamt of; a cinema room, an indoor forest with lots of hammocks, a fully equipped bar and much more!
neighborhood_overview: Grande-Allée Street is located in the heart of Old Quebec, which is where most events and festivals happen all year long. Located at a walking distance from most major attractions like the Parliament, the Château Frontenac and the Plains of Abraham, QBEDS Hostel is right in the middle of all the action! You will also find various bars, cafes and restaurants all along Grande-Allee street and the surrounding streets. This street is also part of the historic town, since it was used in the 19th century as a residential street for the rich upper-class in Quebec City. You can admire the architecture of QBEDS Hostel, which was built in 1900 by William A. Marsh, a rich salesman. You'll notice the historic aspects of our building both inside and outside the building, who was well preserved throughout the years.

name: Villa Montcalm: Prestige & Confort au Vieux-Québec
description:
Immerse yourself in the luxury of Villa Montcalm and create unforgettable memories in the heart of Quebec City. This property has everything to offer an upscale, comfortable and elegant experience, while being close to everything that renowned Old Quebec has to offer.

Book your stay now and enter a world where historical grandeur meets modern elegance.

CITQ #: 313625
neighborhood_overview:
Stay at the gates of Old Quebec, an iconic neighborhood steeped in history in the heart of the city.

Stroll through its cobblestone streets, lined with picturesque buildings with colorful facades. Visit the famous Plains of Abraham, witnessing historical battles, and explore the majestic Château Frontenac that dominates the urban landscape. Art lovers will enjoy local art galleries, while food lovers can enjoy the refined cuisine of renowned restaurants.

With picturesque shops, lively street shows, and stunning views of the St. Lawrence River, Old Quebec offers an unforgettable experience, steeped in culture and timeless charm.

Beyond the tourist attractions offered by nearby Old Quebec, a wealth of cultural experiences — from bookstores and theater to museums, cinema and art galleries — is a short walk from the Villa. Epicureans will be delighted by the proximity of a selection of renowned restaurants, all within walking distance.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

host_about: Chez Gestion Prohost, notre équipe est déterminée à offrir une expérience inégalée aux voyageurs. name: M11 | Le Cavalier - Vintage 1 bed in Old Québec
description: Nestled in the heart of Old Quebec City, the Cavalier Du Moulin offers timeless charm and elegance. This vintage hotel features beautifully restored rooms with classic decor and stunning views of cobblestone streets. Guests can enjoy  complimentary coffee and tea steps away from Quebec's old town's best spots. With nearby attractions like the iconic Château Frontenac and vibrant shops, this hotel provides an enchanting retreat for travellers seeking a taste of Quebec’s rich history.
neighborhood_overview: Quebec City, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a stunning blend of history and culture. Its Old Town, known as Vieux-Québec, features cobblestone streets, charming boutiques, and centuries-old architecture, including the iconic Château Frontenac. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Citadel and Place Royale, as well as enjoy vibrant festivals and local cuisine. With its European flair and rich heritage, Old Town Quebec City offers a captivating experience that transports you back in time, making it a must-visit destination.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier:

neighborhood_overview:
"The Saint-Jean-Baptiste district awaits you!
Come and discover a neighborhood in the heart of Quebec City. Meet warm, authentic, endearing, and passionate people. Discover the richness of its history, architecture, and attractions and be seduced by its artisans.

Fins palaces and gourmands, you have a meeting with the flavors of the Saint-Jean-Baptiste district! Give birth to an afternoon craving in the artisanal shops and delicatessens that are famous for the Faubourg. Share a moment with friends at its friendly bars where locals gather in a friendly way. Discover the many multiethnic restaurants that open their doors.

Come entertain, dance, and watch all kinds of shows in the local bars, pubs, bistros, and cabarets. Under the flakes and hot season, treat yourself to the original boutiques that the neighborhood has to offer: handmade items, import products, and a variety of creations. Visit unique clothing, shoe, and accessory shops in Quebec City.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English.

description:
Superb loft of high standing, located in the Saint Roch district, close to Old Quebec and hundreds of restaurants to go out. The building is part of the architectural trend of the Beaux-Arts style and is freshly renovated.

neighborhood_overview:
Like Griffintown in Montreal or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, the Saint-Roch neighborhood has gone from working-class neighborhood to sought-after place in a few years. Food, culture, technology, fashion, nightlife: discover the Lower Town of Quebec City at its most fashionable!

Some history

One of Quebec City's oldest suburbs, nestled between the cliff leading to the Upper Town and the Saint-Charles River, Saint-Roch has long been a working-class neighborhood. Today, tech companies are headquartered there, young professionals settle there, all while maintaining the typical social mix of the area.

description: Live Canadian life at its best (freshly renovated in November 2017) ! Welcoming loft in the heart of downtown Quebec City. Well located, only minutes away from the historical area. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | Les Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA102
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

The entire area has recently been transformed by a renovation project that has revived old factories and other buildings. You will find many important shopping streets nearby, including Saint-Joseph Street, Saint-Vallier Street East and West and Cartier Avenue in Haute-Ville. So staying here is ideal if you want to have a shopping therapy. These places are also nice places to meet because they are full of good restaurants and cafes

neighborhood_overview:
Streets lined with majestic trees, narrow alleys where children gather to play, old brick buildings with their spiral staircase ... Welcome to Limoilou!

Hghly prized by young families and entrepreneurs, this warm and original district is currently experiencing a great effervescence.

#Limoilove
#Effervescence
#Goodvibe

With its streets and perpendicular avenues, the organization of the district is modeled on New York. By "rising" the 3rd Avenue, between the 2nd and 16th Streets, we come across a host of small businesses that make you want to stop: delicatessens, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea room, glacier…

The gastronomic scene of Limoilou is in full boiling. There are many great chefs and restaurants emerging in this sweet neighborhood. On summer evenings, the terraces swarm with people, each greeting his neighbor in a joyful hubbub typical of the spirit of the neighborhood.

Pubs and microbreweries

neighborhood_overview: How to talk about this great place in just a few words? I would say that the best way to enjoy all the attractions that surround the condo is simply to stroll where your heart tells you!  Whether you're heading up to St-Jean Street and its many restaurants, cafes, bars and shops, or wandering down St-Paul Street to reach Petit-Champlain, every step will be rewarded with great discoveries! The Old Port Market with its local products is just across the street too. In summer, you can access the Bassin st-Louise with its many boats or indulge in the delicious Le Charbon steakhouse located at Gare Du Palais.  You can also easily walk to the famous Château Frontenac and its Dufferin Terrace, Rue du Trésor and Rue St-Louis with all the fine dining restaurants.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

description: Welcome to the Royale, an apartment located on the road to New France, in a historic area of Quebec City. neighborhood_overview:
Beauport is one of the historic and residential neighborhoods in Quebec City, Canada. Located northeast of downtown, it offers a mix of history, quaint charm, and community. Here's a description of Beauport neighborhood:

1. History: Beauport is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Quebec City, with a history that dates back to the 17th century. It was originally a place of French colonization and was centered around agriculture and fishing. Many historic buildings, including stone houses from the colonial days, testify to this rich history.

2. Architecture: The Beauport neighborhood is characterized by its traditional architecture, including French colonial-style stone houses. Tree-lined streets and narrow alleys contribute to the picturesque atmosphere of the neighborhood.

3. Parks and green spaces: Beauport provides easy access to nature and green spaces. Chute-Montmorency Park, with its beautiful waterfalls, is nearby, offering hiking trails, picnic ar
host_about:

Nous sommes Émilie et Dominic un jeune coupe de voyageurs qui est tombé en amour avec le concept des logement de type Airbnb! description:
Click on our logo to see all our properties and choose the one that suits you best, with different sizes, designs, and inclusions.

You will stay in a very nice apartment in a trendy and mixed neighborhood, a few steps from Old-Quebec. Ideal for 4 persons (2 queen size beds). Many amenities available: washer/dryer, dishwasher, air conditioning, WIFI, TV, Nespresso machine... Linens and towels will also be provided. For more information, kindly read the detailed description below.
neighborhood_overview:
Check our website out for more information to help you plan your stay in our beautiful city!

Our apartments are located in downtown Quebec City, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec at 1.3km and visit the typical places such as the Vieux Port, the Petit Champlain, museums, Château Frontenac ... Many restaurants, coffee shops and bars are also available to discover the local gastronomy in a near distance, mainly on St-Joseph street! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Plaines of Abraham or Carrée d’Youville for skating or head to the Terrasse Dufferin to try the longest slide in North America. You will be near the Café Maëlstrom and the Ninna Pizza restaurant, the Intermarché and a local pharmacy.

TO VISIT NEAR BY…

Château Frontenac
Terrasse Dufferin
Plaines of Abraham (great for a pic-nic)
Parlement
Citadelle
Musée national des beaux-art

name: Theater Lofts | Quebec, 201
description:
Welcome to the Lofts du Théâtre!

Sober tones & a touch of gilding are there to contrast with the frenzy of the neighborhood. A timeless signature that exudes calm and warms the atmosphere.

Located in the famous Saint-Roch district and a ten-minute walk from Old Quebec, experience the lively rhythm of the neighborhood day and night. Small neighborhood restaurants, trendy addresses, microbreweries, delicatessens, Saint-Roch has become THE popular spot for foodies.

name: Guest House  Relaxation, Business, Romance Parking
description: Discover this newly constructed apartment in the heart of Sainte-Foy, an urban neighborhood close to Old Quebec and just 10 minutes from Jean-Lesage International Airport. Its stylish atmosphere will charm you. The spacious bedroom is equipped with an ultra-comfortable bed, ideal for lazy mornings. You can also enjoy the heated outdoor pool (open from June 24th to September 15th) and the large private grounds with a barbecue and outdoor fireplace for relaxation during the beautiful seasons.
host_about:
Gagnante à la loto de la vie en naissant dans la magnifique ville de Québec, je suis une aventureuse dans l'âme.  Mère et entrepreneure, j'aime découvrir de nouvelles contrées, déguster un bon vin et... danser ;-)
 L'hospitalité est devenue mon métier par amour pour les gens. Curieuse et perfectionniste, je ferai tout pour que votre séjour soit parfait! Vous pouvez TOUT me demander! Vous doutez? Demandez à mes invités ;-)

Winner at the lottery of life, I am born in the beautiful Québec City.
 I am an adventurer at heart. Mother and entrepreneur, I like to discover new lands, enjoy a good wine and... dance ;-)
 Hospitality has become my job probably because of my love for others. Curious and perfectionist, I will do everything to make your stay perfect! You can ask me anything You doubt? Ask my guests!

description:
For an unforgettable stay, visit Le Glorieux condo in Quebec City. Let yourself be immerged by the Saint-Roch district, cornerstone of central Quebec City in total effervescence. Le Glorieux offers a combination of modernity, luxury and elegance.

CITQ # 310562
neighborhood_overview: La Cité-Limoilou is Québec city’s sprawling central borough. It contains all of Old Quebec, including the striking Château Frontenac, La Citadelle complex, and charming boutique-lined areas like Quartier Petit Champlain. Along the St-Lawrence river, the historic Plains of Abraham Battlefields Park is popular for picnics and panoramic views. The Parliament Building sits on a hill above, and bars and intimate eateries cluster on Rue St-Jean and St-Joseph.
host_about:
I was lucky to grow up in a family where receiving was natural. When there's enough for 6, there's enough for 7, my mother repeated. With an open door and a welcoming heart.
 
For us, our cottage was a sacred place. 800 sq. ft. that could accommodate as many people as our hearts were ready to receive.
 
Simply receive. Welcome warmly. Share and unite to better grow.
 
As I grew up, receiving was no longer just natural, it was necessary.
So from the top of my most sincere values, I made a profession of it:
 
Creating a place getaway in the city, accessible and welcoming, to unite and share.
 
Today, the family is growing with Le Glorieux, where memories will multiply.

neighborhood_overview:
Limoilou is a charming and lively neighborhood with beautiful tree-lined streets and alleys where children play. There are old brick buildings with spiral stairs. It's a much-loved place for young families and entrepreneurs. Right now, the neighborhood is experiencing great vitality.
The street organization is similar to that of New York, with perpendicular streets and avenues. Walking on 3rd Avenue, between the 2nd and 16th Streets, we discover many attractive small shops: delicatessens, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea rooms, ice cream parlors... In summer, a part of 3rd Avenue is reserved for pedestrians.

neighborhood_overview:
Beauport is one of the historic and residential neighborhoods in Quebec City, Canada. Located northeast of downtown, it offers a mix of history, quaint charm, and community. Here's a description of Beauport neighborhood:

1. History: Beauport is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Quebec City, with a history that dates back to the 17th century. It was originally a place of French colonization and was centered around agriculture and fishing. Many historic buildings, including stone houses from the colonial days, testify to this rich history.

2. Architecture: The Beauport neighborhood is characterized by its traditional architecture, including French colonial-style stone houses. Tree-lined streets and narrow alleys contribute to the picturesque atmosphere of the neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview:
La Basse-Ville de Québec is a historic district below the Haute-Ville, at the foot of the cliff overlooking the St. Lawrence River. It is a dynamic and lively place, full of shops, restaurants, bars and art galleries.

One of the main attractions of Basse-Ville is the Old Port of Quebec City, where visitors can take boat rides, river cruises, or kayak tours on the St. Lawrence River. The port is also the departure point of the river shuttle that connects the Lower Town to Lévis, on the other side of the river.

Rue Saint-Paul is another important historic street in Lower Town, lined with shops, restaurants, and art galleries. Visitors can experience the old architecture and admire the colorful facades of the buildings that border it.

The neighborhood is also home to museums, such as the Museum of Civilization, the Quebec City Naval Museum, and the Place Royale Museum, which traces the history of this city's iconic place.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment includes 2 parking spots included, which makes it easy to explore the city by car. However, if you prefer public transportation there is a main bus lane just a 2-minute walk away, offering easy access to all major Quebec City attractions.

Our apartment is in a great location near the magnificent Parc des Braves and the historic Plains of Abraham, offering plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities, picnics and quiet walks. The central location also means you will be close to a variety of restaurants, cafes and shops, allowing you to fully experience the local culture.

This family neighborhood is perfect for a peaceful and relaxing stay.

neighborhood_overview: Saint-Roch is animated by a host of neighborhood shops, a commercial street where cohabiting cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bar and neighborhood shops. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

description:
Click on my picture to see all our properties and choose the one that suits you best! Some units include two bedrooms or smaller studios.

You will stay in a very nice apartment in a trendy neighborhood, a few steps from Old Quebec. Ideal for 2 persons with a beautiful king-size bed. neighborhood_overview:
Check our website out for more information to help you plan your stay in our beautiful city!

Our apartments are located in downtown Quebec City, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec at 1.3km and visit the typical places such as the Vieux Port, the Petit Champlain, museums, Château Frontenac ... Many restaurants, coffee shops and bars are also available to discover the local gastronomy in a near distance, mainly on St-Joseph street! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Plaines of Abraham or Carrée d’Youville for skating or head to the Terrasse Dufferin to try the longest slide in North America. You will be near the Café Maëlstrom and the Ninna Pizza restaurant, the Intermarché and a local pharmacy.

TO VISIT NEAR BY…

Château Frontenac
Terrasse Dufferin
Plaines of Abraham (great for a pic-nic)
Parlement
Citadelle
Musée national des beaux-art

name: Logement en bordure du Fleuve
description: Apartment on the edge of the St. Lawrence River on the walks of Champlain and close to several other attractions. Take advantage of the bikes and electric scooters available on site to visit Old Quebec. Our basement home is tastefully decorated, well appointed, and soundproofed. With 2 bedrooms, a living room and an equipped kitchen, it offers optimal comfort with radiant floors and an air conditioning system.
host_about:
Bonjour, 

Je suis un homme d'affaires oeuvrant dans le domaine de l'immobilier, ce qui me permet d'avoir beaucoup de temps pour voyager. Mes voyages sont variés, soit en famille, entre amis ou bien seul en road trip avec ma moto. J'aime découvrir du pays et rencontrer des gens sympathiques !

name: SPACIOUS APT. CLOSE TO OLD QC WITH KING BED | B06
description:
Click on our logo to see all our properties and choose the one that suits you best!

Splendid and spacious apartment ideally located in a popular area of Quebec City just steps away from Old Quebec. The apartment is equipped to accommodate 2 people (queen-size bed). Wifi, dishwasher, washing and drying machine, air conditioning, Wifi, and TV are also included. Linens and towels will be provided. For more information, kindly read the detailed description below.
neighborhood_overview:
Check our website out for more information to help you plan your stay in our beautiful city!

Our apartments are located in downtown Quebec City, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec at 1.3km and visit the typical places such as the Vieux Port, the Petit Champlain, museums, Château Frontenac ... Many restaurants, coffee shops and bars are also available to discover the local gastronomy in a near distance, mainly on St-Joseph street! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Plaines of Abraham or Carrée d’Youville for skating or head to the Terrasse Dufferin to try the longest slide in North America. You will be near the Café Maëlstrom and the Ninna Pizza restaurant, the Intermarché and a local pharmacy.

TO VISIT NEAR BY…

Château Frontenac
Terrasse Dufferin
Plaines of Abraham (great for a pic-nic)
Parlement
Citadelle
Musée national des beaux-art

Bienvenue au 77 St-Vallier, une résidence de tourisme offrant de superbes appartements meublés situés à moins de 1.3 km du Vieux-Québec où notre équipe se fera un plaisir de vous accueillir!

En réservant avec le 77 St-Vallier, vous bénéficierez d'offres exclusives conçues par nos merveilleux partenaires pour nos clients! Un lien vous sera transmis après la confirmation de réservation et vous pouvez visitez notre site internet pour les découvrir.

Shops in the area specialize in handmade and vintage items, as well as clothing from local designers.

name: Centre de la belle ville de Québec, super équipé
description:
Well equipped for stay +32 days: beautiful 3.5 apartment with separate bedroom, private entrance, balcony, kitchen & good accessories, office area, high speed internet, bathroom with washer and electric dryer +grocery stores nearby. Everything is done on foot.

Quiet street, it is possible to find parking on request, if required

A 20-minute walk from the tourist area, you live in a "hip" sector of Quebec City with multimedia workers + universities.
neighborhood_overview:
It is the central and vibrant area of the city, ideal for work, study and outings. Rue Saint-Joseph was and remains Quebec City's main street, where there are restaurants, cafes, entertainment venues and microbreweries and bars.

Filled with young media workers and university students, the industry has been reinstated for 20-25 years. It used to be a concentration of factories, especially in the shoes.

Everything is done on foot or by bus ( the city is to be developed by tram) or by Uber or taxi. You can walk to the tourist and hotel zone ( Old Quebec) in 15-20 minutes. Your host is a certified tour guide and can give you a free guided tour if you wish
host_about: Professionnels en soins infirmier et en science économique, nous demeurons au centre ville de Québec, dans un secteur animé mais tranquille, au sein d'un petit édifice familial  dont nous réalisons un peu d'hébergement saisonnier. Nous voyageons régulièrement et nous aimons faire découvrir notre belle ville, étant guide certifié

host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

name: Château Deluxe // Vieux-Québec, Énorme Maison
description:
3000 square feet ancestral house in the heart of Quebec city. This house was built in the late 1800's, although I just renovated in order to host travellers around the world that want to experience a unique stay.

This typical Old-Quebec house is usually split between 2 units for travellers. Therefore, the 2nd floor is only accessible from the outside. Perfect house for groups that need the extra rooms.

This is a can't miss opportunity if you are travelling as a group in Quebec city!
neighborhood_overview: Situated on Saint-Vallier street in Saint-Roch, you will be at proximity of many excellent restaurants as well as a walking distance of all commodities and popular attractions.
host_about: Deluxe Apartments is more than just a place to stay, it's an elevated standard of traveling to Québec City. Nestled in prime locations, our condos redefine luxury, offering a fusion of sophistication and comfort. With meticulous attention to detail, each condo boasts opulent interiors, premium amenities, and breathtaking comfort. Our commitment to excellence extends beyond luxurious living spaces; it's about crafting an unparalleled experience.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | By  Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA401
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

name: Spacious & Bright Studio | 1.3 km Old-QC | B09
description:
Are you looking for an apartment with a private bedroom for such an affordable price? Click on our logo to see all our properties!

Very spacious and comfortable studio ideally located in a popular district of Quebec City, close to Old Quebec. The accommodation is equipped to accommodate 2 people (queen-size bed). Air conditioning, dishwasher, WiFi, television, sheets, and towels will be provided. More information is available in the description below.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located north of Quebec City, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec and visit the typical places: the Old Port, the Champlain district, the museums… Many bars and restaurants are also available to discover the local gastronomy! You can take advantage of the bay of Beauport or the Marina Saint-Roch to bathe and sunbathe in summer ; in winter you can go to the winter sports site of Pointe-aux-Lièvres or go skating at the Carrée d 'Youville!

You will be close to the Louis Marchand and Company bakery, the Rochon grocery store and a pharmacy.

To visit :
- Le Musée national des beaux-arts du Québec.
- La Citadelle de Québec.
- Place Royale.

To eat :
- The Italian restaurant Battuto (with reservation only)
- The restaurant Nina Pizza
- The restaurant La Cuisine
- The gastronomic restaurant Chez Boulay - Bistro Boréal

Things to do :
- Enjoy the Plains of Abraham Park.
- Discover
host_about:
Bienvenue au 77 St-Vallier, une résidence de tourisme offrant de superbes appartements meublés situés à moins de 1.3 km du Vieux-Québec où notre équipe se fera un plaisir de vous accueillir!

En réservant avec le 77 St-Vallier, vous bénéficierez d'offres exclusives conçues par nos merveilleux partenaires pour nos clients! Un lien vous sera transmis après la confirmation de réservation et vous pouvez visitez notre site internet pour les découvrir.

Very comfy queen bed, washer and dryer available directly in the apartment, balcony and parking. You have all you need to cook. We are available to help you and answer your questions :)

Welcome!

name: Urban Getaway | A/C | Minimalist | Terrace
description: Ideal for families or small groups, located in a new building, comfortable and well-equipped. With a SuperHost at your disposal, your stay is a guaranteed success. Decorated with care, the accommodation is intended as a second home.
neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Sô, as its residents affectionately call it, is a working-class neighborhood which, over the last few years, has been welcoming an increasing number of young families and professionals looking for a genuine community spirit. Welcome to the Lower Town!

In order to discover all the little treasures hidden throughout Saint-Sauveur, you need to take rue Saint-Vallier Ouest, the main commercial corridor. At every step, you'll find nice neighborhood restaurants with unbeatable value for money, a café, a bakery, pubs, bars, great independent shops... Or else, well-hidden in the recesses of adjoining streets, you'll find Asian grocery stores, handicraft shops and institutions that have withstood the passage of time and trends!
host_about: Étant moi même voyageur, j'ai l'habitude d'héberger des gens que ce soit par le biais de Couchsurfing ou HospitalityClub. Je travaille dans l'industrie du tourisme et il me fera plaisir de vous partager des informations personnalisées et pertinentes sur ce que vous voulez voir/faire lors de votre visite. Bienvenue aux amoureux de la musique!

neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

name: L'Intemporel l'appartement  31 jours et plus
description:
*IMPORTANT: MONTHLY RENTAL 31 AND MORE EXCLUSIVELY. ﻿


The Intemporel apartment is located in the heart of Vieux-Limoilou. It's an authentic, trendy experience that will set the tone for your stay no matter the length of time. This apartment will be the perfect base from which you will be in Quebec City. **Available for temporary monthly all-inclusive rentals.** Parking is available at the door.
** Monthly price may vary by season **
neighborhood_overview: It is close to everything, grocery stores, cafes, bakeries and the many restaurants in the area.
host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: Deluxe Estate - Two in One  Downtown Québec City
description:
Deluxe Estate represents two of the nicest condos you can find in Quebec city. This venue is perfectly situated on St-Joseph street, making it the perfect spot for a gathering with familly and friends. The two units are seperated one on top of the other and accessible individualy. This makes it the best of both worlds as you can have some privacy and quiet time as well as having open-concept lofts to gather and enjoy time together.

CITQ (#300355)
neighborhood_overview: Saint-Joseph is probably the most attractive neighborhood on the city, it is urban and hip. Its central location will allow you to get anywhere very easily. Take a walk over St-Joseph and Saint -Vallier streets and enjoy the best offer of trendy bars, restaurants and boutiques. You have also many groceries stores nearby. Getting to the Old Québec and Petit Champlain is very easy from there.  You won't get bored with everything there is to do there. Indeed, it's also close to the Central train station !
host_about: Deluxe Apartments is more than just a place to stay, it's an elevated standard of traveling to Québec City. Nestled in prime locations, our condos redefine luxury, offering a fusion of sophistication and comfort. With meticulous attention to detail, each condo boasts opulent interiors, premium amenities, and breathtaking comfort. Our commitment to excellence extends beyond luxurious living spaces; it's about crafting an unparalleled experience.

name: [LOFT-612] High End Downtown Condo with Great View
description:
Feel home at this high end, newly renovated condo located in hip Nouvo St-Roch area (Downtown Quebec City). The place is perfect for staying in the liveliest area of Quebec or as a base for remote work.

It has stylish design & feel spacious. It has balcony, living/dining room, bathroom, laundry room and you can enjoy sunsets from the living room.

It is equipped with a high end kitchen, minimalist bathroom, AC & high ceilings.

It is a top floor unit with no neighbor above.

FREE PARKING!
neighborhood_overview: Nouvo St-Roch is where the action happens in iconic Quebec city! Quebec City is the oldest city in North America with tons of things to do. From living over 10 years in the city, it is my favorite place where there is always something to do and the choice of restaurants/bars is the best in the city. Everything can be done by walking, car is not necessary at all. If you are a foodie, you will love it! It is conveniently located right next to Montcalm (high end residential area), St-Jean-Baptiste (hip bar area), Old Quebec (tourist area), St-Sauveur (up and coming area) and Limoilou (relax dining area).
host_about:
I come from Canada, I love to travel and try new foods & drinks. 

I am a HUGE snowboard addict, I always look forward hitting the best powder spots in the world during winter. 

I own my online business and travel either for work or discover new places! 

Been to USA, Japan, Taiwan, China, Vietnam, Philippines, Thailand, France, United Kingdom, Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Bahamas, Dominican Republic, Colombia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Vietnam and more to come.

I became a Airbnb host because most of the time, when I rented other's places, I felt like it was missing something. Some hosts did have wonderful places which I tried to implement to my ones as well. I aim to provide some of the best places for those who want to work from home or just get away and relax. 

Lastly, I'm a coffee lover, so please expect some nice coffee setup at my places as a standard.

name: Initial | Nouveau monde | Centre-ville de Québec
description:
It was in 1535 that Jacques Cartier discovered Quebec City. Five years later he decided to settle there thinking of building a NEW WORLD because of his discoveries that he mistakenly believed were diamonds and gold. It will be necessary to wait 60 years later, with the arrival of Samuel de Champlain, for the founding of Quebec in 1608 and the French colonization.

CITQ 304873
neighborhood_overview: Saint-Roch is animated by a host of local shops, a commercial street where cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bar and local shops coexist. The area is a few minutes' walk from the Historic Quarter of Old Québec, the Old Port of Québec and the Train Station.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

Welcome to the original loft, enjoy this warm space in the center of the vibrant Saint-Roch district. The designated place to enjoy all the best Quebec City has to offer.

CITQ 309212


Property managed exclusively by initial rental
Our initials, our signature, our guarantee of an impeccable stay.
neighborhood_overview: Saint-Roch is animated by a host of neighborhood shops, a shopping street where cohabitants cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bar and neighborhood shops. The area is a few minutes' walk from the Historic District of Old Quebec, the Old Port of Quebec and the train station.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: Cozy apartment in the heart of the Art District
description:
3 days rental minimum.

Established in a century-old Tudor-style house, our house is the perfect place to experience Quebec City on foot or by public transport. Depending on the direction chosen, everything is accessible within a more or less 15-minute walk and 2 bus stops are located on René-Lévesque O on either side of the house (lines 800, 801 and 9 other lines). The apartment was completely renovated recently and pictures are now updated.
neighborhood_overview: Newly appointed as the "Art District", Montcalm is distinguished by the diversity of its commercial frame which includes more than 200 institutions of all kinds. Amongst those, you will find restaurants, bars, cafes, art galleries, museums, cinema, delis, trendy shops, health services and much more, located less than one kilometer away from our place. A booming sector awaiting to be discovered!!
host_about: Nous sommes un couple de gens curieux de musique, de voyage et de diversité humaine. Nous sommes actifs, dynamiques et aimons découvrir les petits trésors cachés des endroits visités. Nous nous sommes procurée cette belle et vieille maison pour l'enrichir de nos rencontres et espérons que vous en ferez partie. Québec est une ville extraordinaire et nous serions plus qu'heureux de vous aider à vous la faire découvrir.

name: P205 - Les Lofts St-Paul - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in patrimonial buildings dating from the 17th century on territories that have been inhabited by native peoples, Les Lofts St-Paul will transport you in an atmosphere true to the Québec City’s past.
In the heart of the Old Port of Québec, you will be able to wander day or night in its enchanting streets where you will find numerous authentic restaurants, shops and antique dealers offering you unforgettable culinary and artistic discoveries.
Only a few meters from the cruise terminal.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful sites of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street is one of the oldest commercial streets in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

name: Grand loft au coeur de la ville de Québec
description:
Beautiful loft fully equipped in the heart of the Limoilou district with parking.
This loft is ideal for two couples or a family.
It is a 5-minute walk from the Saint-Roch district and a 20-minute walk from the Saint-Jean Baptiste/Haute-Ville district.
Public transport is easily accessible. The Île d 'Orléans, Montmorency Falls, children's parks, cafés, distillery, restaurants and bars are nearby.
Come and enjoy the beautiful city of Quebec in this spacious loft!
neighborhood_overview:
The Limoilou neighborhood is a central part of Quebec City. You will find everything you need: restaurant, bar, cafe, bakery, distillery, children's park and water games, municipal swimming pool, bike path and bus network.
The loft is located very close to the Saint-Charles River Linear Trail. You can go for a walk or bike ride along the riverside.
A walk on 3rd Avenue is also a must!
You can also make a stop at the Stadaconé Distillery, the bread box, the 900 pizzeria and the many cafes on 3rd Avenue.
host_about:
Bonjour, 
Je suis une amoureuse de la nature et des montagnes. C'est pourquoi j'ai choisi la magnifique municipalité de Petite Rivière Saint-François. Nous passons des moments inoubliables en famille ici.

name: City View - CITQ 309980
neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch is one of the oldest suburbs in Quebec City. In 1692, the Reglieux Order of the Recollets had built on the shore of the Saint-Charles River a chapel dedicated to Saint Roch de Montpellier, but which will be destroyed during the War of 1754. Possibly, this hermitage will give its name to Rue Saint-Roch, then to the faubourg, the parish, and finally to the neighborhood of the same name. You will find plenty of activities.
Let yourself be intoxicated by the Saint-Roch district, theater, concerts, pub shows, gastronomic experiences, artisans, near parks and gardens to stroll and relax at your leisure.
Served by public transport, close to Gare du Palais.
Free public parking from 9: 00 p.m. to 9: 00 a.m.
A neighborhood adapted to today's life trends

description:
Beautiful condo located less than 500m from Old Quebec and all attractions, restaurants and more!

Come and discover the city in this beautiful 2 bedroom condo. Well equipped and air-conditioned.

Close to Old Quebec and the main tourist sites:
- Château Frontenac;

neighborhood_overview: Old Quebec is a beautiful place to discover!! History, restaurants, bars, activities, discoveries and more!
host_about:
Chalets Plaisirs, créateur de souvenirs!

Chalets Plaisirs est spécialisé dans la location et la gestion d’hébergements touristiques à travers la province de Québec.

L'entreprise propose à sa clientèle une grande variété de résidences touristiques en location de type court terme et long terme, ainsi qu'un service clé en main en gestion locative pour plusieurs de ses clients.

Les voyageurs à la recherche d’un endroit pour les vacances pourront profiter de chalets et de condos exceptionnels et y vivre une expérience des plus inoubliables !

N'hésitez pas à communiquer avec nous pour toutes questions ou commentaires.

L'on vous souhaite un agréable séjour :)

name: City Center, 2 salles de bain, Parking, Terrasse
description:
You will be charmed by this new apartment in the heart of Quebec City. Its location, next to major roads, between Old Quebec and Saint-Roch make it the perfect place to visit Quebec City. You can enjoy the tourist, historic and architectural attractions of Old Quebec, while enjoying the restaurants, bars and liveliness of the Saint-Roch district.
The 1000 square feet of the modern-style apartment will ensure you a stay of incomparable quality.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is at the limit of two main district: Saint Roch and The Old Québec
You will enjoy the history, the old architecture, and the main touristic sites of the Old Québec. While in the other hand you have access to a large selection of shops, bars, microbreweries and restaurants in a more authentic district named Saint Roch.

host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

Chalets Plaisirs, créateur de souvenirs!

Chalets Plaisirs est spécialisé dans la location et la gestion d’hébergements touristiques à travers la province de Québec.

L'entreprise propose à sa clientèle une grande variété de résidences touristiques en location de type court terme et long terme, ainsi qu'un service clé en main en gestion locative pour plusieurs de ses clients.

Les voyageurs à la recherche d’un endroit pour les vacances pourront profiter de chalets et de condos exceptionnels et y vivre une expérience des plus inoubliables !

neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch is one of the oldest suburbs in Quebec City. In 1692, the Reglieux Order of the Recollets had built on the shore of the Saint-Charles River a chapel dedicated to Saint Roch de Montpellier, but which will be destroyed during the War of 1754. Possibly, this hermitage will give its name to Rue Saint-Roch, then to the faubourg, the parish, and finally to the neighborhood of the same name. You'll find plenty of activities there.
Let yourself be poisoned by the Saint-Roch district, theater, concerts, shows, pubs, gastronomic experiences, craftsmen, near parks and gardens to stroll and relax at your leisure.
Served by public transport, close to the Gare du Palais train station.
Free public parking from 9pm to 9am.
A neighborhood adapted to the ecological trends of today's life.

name: Heritage Home in Old Town (1500 sf)
description:
Located inside the UNESCO designated Historic District of Old Quebec, the home has scenic views of the old Port, St. Lawrence River and mountains.

Spacious 1500 square feet apartment built during the British Empire in the early 1800s, with high ceilings and most of its original architectural beauty.

Good size balcony to enjoy the view on warm summer days. A nice private patio facing south.

Free parking on premises for one (sometimes two) small to mid size vehicles such as minivans and SUVs.
neighborhood_overview: The home is in one of the best areas of Old Quebec. It is a quiet, peaceful area with beautiful historic homes, all within a few minutes of bustling streets such as St-Jean, St-Paul, St-Louis and major attractions.

neighborhood_overview:
Grande-Allée:

Nicknamed the Champs Élysées of Quebec, Grande-Allée is famous for its numerous restaurants, bars, and terraces. It’s a nightlife hub where one can find legendary establishments such as:

Le Patio du Festibière: A new festive & casual bar on Grande-Allée. A typically local spot that’s unpretentious with an unmatched atmosphere! THE place for those who love to enjoy the best of summer all year round!
Le Dagobert: A historic multi-story nightclub.
Les Voûtes de Napoléon: A singer-songwriter bar to enjoy Quebec folk music.
L’Atelier: A chic restaurant-bar known for its mixology.
Faite à l’os: Master of the grill, Faite à l’os offers the typical American barbecue experience.
Plains of Abraham:

A historic site that was the scene of the battle between the French and the English in 1759. Today, it’s a large park where one can stroll, picnic, and enjoy cultural events.

Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the center of Old Quebec with tons of amazing shopping, great restaurants, culture and history. Explore the oldest city in North America easily at any time of the year.

Walk score of 10. On the street adjacent to the building, there are multiple coffee shops, restaurants, a grocery store, a park, hardware store, boutiques and small shops. All within a short five minute walk or less.

Designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1985, Old Québec is the most intact fortified town north of Mexico, retaining its colonial architecture for over 400 years. It is the historic and cultural heart of Québec City, and the birthplace of French North America.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

host_about:
Nous sommes un couple mixte et nous vivons à Québec. Nous aimons la vie sous toutes ses formes : bien manger, boire, dormir, flâner, écouter de la musique et beaucoup bricoler et partager. 
Pour nous le contact est primordial, il nous nourrit. Rencontrer du monde de partout et leur offrir notre univers est ce que nous avons de plus précieux et c'est pourquoi nous sommes ici. 

We are a mixed couple and we live in Quebec City. We love life in all its forms: eating well, drinking, sleeping, strolling, listening to music, tinkering and sharing.
For us the contact is primordial, it nourishes us. To meet people from all over the world and to offer them our universe is what we have most precious and that is why we are on this platform.

neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Jean-Baptiste, often called Faubourg Saint-Jean, is a district of Quebec City within the borough of La Cité–Limoilou. It is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Quebec City, the old part remaining corresponding to the old working-class neighbourhood organized around the Saint Jean Baptiste church while the newer part is occupied mainly by the Quebec government and large hotels. Several important monuments are part of this neighborhood.

- Centre des congrets
- Parliament
- Place Hauteville and Observatory
- Quebec City Convention Center
- Place de la Capitale
- Maison de Radio-Canada
- Martello Tower no. 4
- J. A. Moisan grocery store
All within a 5-minute walk

description:
Located in a freshly built establishment, this signature Loft is situated in a cultural, commercial and trendy district. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop patio. Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and more!
Elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea

neighborhood_overview:
''What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go! In summer, rue Saint-Joseph converts into a pedestrian-only street every weekend.
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you! ''

Source: Destination Québec Cité / St-Roch neighbourhood
