neighborhood_overview:
Like Griffintown in Montreal or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, the Saint-Roch neighborhood has gone from working-class neighborhood to sought-after place in a few years. Food, culture, technology, fashion, nightlife: discover the Lower Town of Quebec City at its most fashionable!

Some history

One of Quebec City's oldest suburbs, nestled between the cliff leading to the Upper Town and the Saint-Charles River, Saint-Roch has long been a working-class neighborhood. Today, tech companies are headquartered there, young professionals settle there, all while maintaining the typical social mix of the area.

My apartment is located at the entrance of downtown Quebec City, at the corner of Charest and Langelier boulevards. It is located in the heart of the St-Roch district.

The area is particularly popular with foodies: the excellent tables adjoin the small neighborhood restaurants where you eat well at a very good price, while the microbreweries have the wind in the sails and brew fresh refreshing beers. Do not forget to visit a delicatessen to bring the local terroir home!

In the summer, young web and video game professionals mingle with students to dine al fresco in the Jean-Paul-L'Allier garden, an oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.

In winter, the neighborhood hosts a lit Christmas tree 15 meters, quite fairy. The area has also hosted the Jamboree since 2005, the FIS Snowboard and Freeski World Cup. If you want to be full of strong emotions, this is where it happens!

name: La Chouenneuse (studio) - no 301518
description: La Chouenneuse wants to be a place of life and meetings where we can tell each other stories of life. " Chouenner " is an expression of my native region " Charlevoix " which means: talking about things and others, with friends while having fun between us. Less than 10 km from the major attractions of Quebec City, almost in the heart of the city, in a quiet neighborhood, a few steps from a bike path, bus circuit around the corner, close to restaurants ...Come meet us!
neighborhood_overview:
Lise's accommodation is located in Québec,Canada.
Our house is located in the Saint-Sauveur district in the old parish of Notre-Dame-de-Pitié. It was called the "village", because it is the corner of the lower town that gathers a series of small houses, baptized with street names in homage to the generals of the war. This area was built by the army during the war to allow women to work in the vicinity of their family home in the ammunition factories of the nearby Saint-Malo area. Today, the neighborhood still welcomes small families and especially workers. It is located close to services and work. It is close to everything and very quiet.
host_about: Je vous invite chez moi  dans le quartier de mon enfance. Je suis conseillère en communication dans le domaine socio-communautaire, en environnement et culture. Je partage ma vie avec ma Loulou et ma chatte Mimi.

neighborhood_overview:
Lovely Calm Boho in Beauport is an ideal resort for tourists looking to discover the Quebec City area. This address is close to several tourist attractions, activities and restaurants to meet everyone's desires.

Among the must-sees in the area, the Parc de la Chute-Montmorency is a majestic natural site only 10 minutes drive from the address. This 83-meter high waterfall offers breathtaking views of the St. Lawrence River and offers many activities such as ziplining, via ferrata and descent as a reminder.

For lovers of history and culture, Old Quebec is a gem to discover. It is about a 20-minute drive from the address and offers unique architecture, fascinating history, and refined gastronomy. The Château Frontenac, the Museum of Civilization and the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Québec are some of the must-see attractions.

Athletes will not be left behind with the activities offered nearby such as golf, hiking, skiing, snowmobiling and fishing. Mont-Sainte

host_about:
Garçon sympathique et ouvert d'esprit, aime la vie simple et pas compliquée. J'aime le camping, la petite chasse et la pêche, la grande forêt, les rivières sauvages. Mais j'aime aussi ma vie d'urbain: bon restos, bons vins, bon livres. Et voyager, bien sûr. Jusqu'à maintenant j'ai vu l'Europe, l'Inde et l'Amérique du Sud. Je suis agent de recherche au gouvernement du Québec.


Friendly and openminded guy, I like the simple and uncomplicated life. I love camping, hunting and fishing , large forests, wild rivers. But I also like my urban life: good restaurants, good wine  good books. And travel, of course. Until now I have seen Europe, India  and South America. I'm a research agent for the Quebec government.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | By  Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA100
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | Par Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA203
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

name: Sommet de la basse-ville / Downtown
description: Welcome to Sommet de la Basse-Ville, a condo located in Quebec City's new hour district, on the top floor of an entirely new building! A stone's throw from Old Quebec and the Plains of Abraham, the Sommet offers a fully equipped condo with air conditioning and private indoor parking. You will also have access to a terrace equipped with a rooftop BBQ, a workout room as well as a private balcony with stunning views of Quebec City and the Laurentians!
neighborhood_overview: Located in a bustling area, you will find excellent restaurants, cafes, microbreweries, a theatre and many shops within walking distance. A stone's throw from Old Quebec and the Plains of Abraham, you're in the perfect place to immerse yourself in the history of Quebec City!
host_about:
Bonjour à vous!

Nous sommes Émilie, Dominic, Lauriane et Philippe et nous sommes les North Travelers. Nous sommes deux couples d'amis qui, après avoir fait un voyage en Europe, sommes tombés en amour avec les logements de type Airbnb! Nous avons construit de nombreux souvenirs et avons adoré le fait de pouvoir avoir le confort d'une maison au prix d'une chambre d'hôtel! Voulant partager cette expérience au Québec, nous nous sommes lancés dans l'aventure de devenir des hôtes Airbnb! Il nous fera plaisir de vous accueillir dans ce logement qui, nous l'espérons, vous fera sentir comme à la maison! Au plaisir et bon séjour! :)

name: Quebec and restaurants at your feet! - w/parking!
description:
New condo in downtown Quebec City, fully equipped. 52 square meters (560 square feet.). Many of the most beautiful sites in Quebec to visit nearby. Located in a trendy area of the city, many excellent restaurants and shops are within walking distance.

Free and secure underground parking in the building.
neighborhood_overview: The condo is located on the edge of Nouvo Saint-Roch, in a trendy neighborhood offering a multitude of restaurants, cafes (Nektar coffee shop), bars and micro-brewery (Griendel) and pastries. Several restaurants located within 5 minutes walk are among the best listed on Trip Advisor (Battuto, L'Affaire est ketchup, Patente et Machin, Le Renard et la Chouette, Nina Neapolitan Pizza, Bati Bassak, Le Clocher penché... ). The condo gives you easy access to the main attractions of Old Quebec,  12 minutes from Cartier Street, Notre-Dame-de-Quebec Basilica, Fortifications-of-Quebec, National Museum of Fine Arts, Chateau Frontenac , the Dufferin Terrace, the Old Port. 15 minutes walk from the Quebec City Convention Center. Less than 10 minutes from the Saint-Charles River Corridor Bike Trail. The Walkscore site gives a rating of 88 to the condo's location (the Old-Quebec is 87!).
host_about:
Je m'appelle Pierre et je suis originaire de la ville de Québec. Après plusieurs années à travailler comme ingénieur, j’ai acheté une charmante petite auberge située à St-Jean-des-Piles (Shawinigan), si vous passez dans la région, elle se nomme La Maison Cadorette!

Malgré tout, je me devais de garder un lien avec ma ville natale que j'adore. J'occupe donc un condominium dans ce qui est certainement le quartier le plus dynamique de la cité. Comme je ne peux y être que de façon intermittente, c'est avec plaisir que je le mets à votre disposition! Vous vous y sentirez comme chez vous, vous verrez!

neighborhood_overview: Saint-Roch is full of trendy restaurants, bars, and shopping! You will find my recommendations there.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

CITQ 297092
Superb high-end apartment with stones on the walls, located in the Montcalm district, close to Old Quebec. 1 double retractable bed, 1 queen-size bed. Hair dryer, ironing set, air-conditioning and fan are also included. Bed linen and towels will be provided. Please note that check-in is done autonomously from 3pm and check-out until 11am on the day of departure. For more information do not hesitate to read the detailed description below.:)
neighborhood_overview:
The place is located in the Montcalm district of Quebec City.

Stroll through the unusual streets of the Montcalm district to discover all its hidden treasures. From the Côte d 'Abraham to Boulevard René-Lévesque, from Salaberry Street to Avenue Honoré-Mercier, the unique senses and the coasts form a small green and coquettish labyrinth. Its stairs, its colors, its narrow houses and its dormers make the SJB district a painting worthy of the greatest films.

On every street corner, turning your gaze to the Lower Town can make us discover breathtaking sunsets, whose colors stretch far and wide over the Laurentians. However, its historical and natural charm is not the only element that characterizes it: the traders and craftsmen who live there have created a neighborhood life that makes everyone happy. Montcalm is a relaxed neighborhood with bars, gourmet pubs, brasseries and trendy cafes, located along its main street, the Grande allée. You will be able to find all

description:
License - (314830) Discover beautiful Quebec. An apartment with a superb kitchen and a closed bedroom for your comfort and your space in the heart of the city center. Bienvenue à tous.
Discover the beautiful city of Quebec and its charming Old-Quebec. An apartment with a superb kitchen and private bedroom for your comfort and your space in the middle of the Downtown area. Welcome everybody.
neighborhood_overview:
The Saint-Roch neighbourhood is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Quebec City. A constantly buzzing neighborhood combining media technology and cultural life with its trendy Rue Saint-Joseph (libraries, theatres, theatre, shops and very friendly restaurants and bars), all to make your stay as pleasant as possible.
We are located in Saint Roch's district, one of the oldest districts of Quebec. A district in constant effervescence where get married technologies-media and cultural life to its very trendy street named Saint Joseph (Libraries(Bookcases), theaters, shops, restaurants and very nice bars,), everything you need to make your stay really pleasant.
host_about:
Nous sommes un couple mixte et nous vivons à Québec. Nous aimons la vie sous toutes ses formes : bien manger, boire, dormir, flâner, écouter de la musique et beaucoup bricoler et partager. 
Pour nous le contact est primordial, il nous nourrit. Rencontrer du monde de partout et leur offrir notre univers est ce que nous avons de plus précieux et c'est pourquoi nous sommes ici. 

We are a mixed couple and we live in Quebec City. We love life in all its forms: eating well, drinking, sleeping, strolling, listening to music, tinkering and sharing.
For us the contact is primordial, it nourishes us. To meet people from all over the world and to offer them our universe is what we have most precious and that is why we are on this platform.

You will love this loft in the heart of Downtown Quebec!

In the heart of Quebec City!

name: Le meilleur des deux mondes
description:
Superb apartment well soundproofed,safe, very clean with comfortable beds provided with a small terrace. You feel right at home; this apartment is really well located,it's between
5 and 15 minutes from all the festivities everything is on foot. The Apartment is on the second floor 8 steps to climb. Located in the district of St Jean Baptiste. The building dates from 1854 and is renovated in accordance with its original design.
neighborhood_overview: Château Frontenac is 15 minutes away, St Jean Street is 3 minutes even the lower town as St Joseph Street is 10 minutes away. The wide alley for its bars, pubs, bistros, restaurants, terraces, the cartier street for its shops ,cafés,  breweries, grocery stores,the small Champlain district not to be missed , the grocery store moisan 7 minutes from the apartment on St jean street is three minutes from the apartment there is everything: bakery, pastry, cold meats,grocery store, café restaurant pub, for those interested the bar the very popular dredger, you have access to everything inside 15 minutes walk while keeping the tranquility and comfort of the apartment.
host_about:
Je suis une personne joviale , accueillante , respectueuse et responsable. Qui utilise les services d' airbnb pour mes destinations voyages.
J'aime faire la rencontre et recevoir des gens de toutes les nationalités et mon objectif est de leur offrir la sécurité , le confort et les meilleures informations possible pour que leur séjour dans notre belle ville soit un de leur plus beau souvenir.

name: Le 315B Locations Vieux Limoilou "with parking"
description: The 315B is a comfortable apartment loved by visitors. It is bathed in light in summer and winter. It is in the heart of a lively, authentic and very safe neighborhood. It is located a few minutes from old Quebec. Discover the many restaurants in the area or take your meal on our pretty terrace. You have the chance to  discover a very friendly neighbourhood that vibrates with its distinctive character.
neighborhood_overview: The old Limoilou district (former working-class district) stands out from the other districts by its architecture from the beginning of 1800, the proximity of the Cartier Brébeuf park, its local shops, its many restaurants and its simplicity. It is a place where life is good during all seasons. 3rd avenue has seen the birth of many new businesses in the last 5 years, which makes Limoilou a place coveted by Quebecers and tourists.
host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

name: Initial | Loft du Lama | Centre-Ville de Québec
description:
Welcome to the Loft du Lama, a completely renovated loft. A perfect spot to enjoy the city, visit and sleep comfortably!


Nearby parking, free weekend parking.

CITQ #298097
neighborhood_overview: Saint-Roch is animated by a host of neighborhood shops, a shopping street where cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bars and neighborhood shops coexist. The area is within walking distance of the Old Québec Historic Quarter, Old Port of Québec and the Train Station.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

Spacious home in Lebourgneuf neighborhood with 2 bedrooms and a huge backyard. Two free parkings are included. Our 2 bedrooms spacious home is a perfect place for travellers, couples, families, workers. Only 15 minutes by car to Old Quebec

CITQ : 305210
neighborhood_overview:
*Many great restaurants nearby

host_about:
Nous sommes un couple de retraité et profitons de la vie au max avec la santé et l'amour qui nous habitent. 
Notre propriété personnelle bien équipée saura répondre aux besoins de tous vos invités
Toutes les pièces sont situées au RDC et très lumineuses. Vous aurez accès a une très grande terrasse privée.
Située près de sentiers pédestres et cyclables.
Services de transport UBER et autobus vous emmèneront au vieux Québec en peu de temps.

description:
Welcome to our renovated apartment in the heart of Quebec City, 10 minutes from everything!
The apartment is 450 sq. ft. (45 m²) in size and includes a full kitchen, a bathroom with bath and shower, a lounge area with sofa bed, TV + Netflix, a master bedroom with queen bed. It is a charming 3 1/2 with large windows and relaxation area in the rear inner gallery. Peaceful neighborhood near the St. Charles River and its bike path.
neighborhood_overview: Located in the St-Sauveur sector, a short walk from the Upper Town and Old Quebec, our neighborhood is full of Quebec restaurants highly recommended by TripAdvisor. A shopping mall within 100m and all amenities are within a minute's walk. Its proximity to everything and its access to public transport make it a must when it comes to accommodation.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | By  Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA304
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located north of Quebec, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec and visit the typical places: the Old Port, the Champlain district, museums ... Many bars and restaurants are also available to discover the local gastronomy! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Pointe-aux-Lièvres winter sports site or go skating at Carrée d'Youville! You will be near the Louis Marchand et Compagnie bakery, the Rochon grocery store and a pharmacy.

To visit :
- The National Museum of Fine Arts of Quebec.
- The Citadel of Quebec.
- The Place Royale.

To feed yourself :
- The Italian restaurant Battuto (with reservation only)
- The Nina Pizza restaurant
- The restaurant La Cuisine
- The gourmet restaurant Chez Boulay - Bistro Boréal

To do :
- Enjoy the Plains of Abraham park.
- Discover the district of Old Queb

description:

neighborhood_overview:
Check our website out for more information to help you plan your stay in our beautiful city!

Our apartments are located in downtown Quebec City, in Cité-Limoilou. You can reach Old Quebec at 1.3km and visit the typical places such as the Vieux Port, the Petit Champlain, museums, Château Frontenac ... Many restaurants, coffee shops and bars are also available to discover the local gastronomy in a near distance, mainly on St-Joseph street! You can take advantage of Beauport bay or Saint-Roch Marina to swim and sunbathe in summer; in winter you can go to the Plaines of Abraham or Carrée d’Youville for skating or head to the Terrasse Dufferin to try the longest slide in North America. You will be near the Café Maëlstrom and the Nina Pizza restaurant, the Intermarché and a local pharmacy.

TO VISIT NEAR BY…

Château Frontenac
Terrasse Dufferin
Plaines of Abraham (great for a pic-nic)
Parlement
Citadelle
Musée national des beaux-arts

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

description:
Welcome to Artwood - a modern and stylish 2 bedroom apartment nestled at the heart of downtown Quebec City. With its ideal location, contemporary design, and artistic touches, Artwood offers an unforgettable stay for guests looking for comfort, convenience, and an artistic touch.

CITQ 310826

Our initials, our signature, our guarantee of an impeccable stay.
neighborhood_overview: On the edge of the Saint-Roch and Saint-Sauveur districts, animated by a host of neighborhood shops, shopping streets where cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bars and local shops. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview: Peaceful and central neighborhood, safe and family-friendly.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: SF100 - Lofts St-François - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in a freshly built establishment, this signature Loft is situated in a cultural, commercial and trendy district. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop patio. Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and more!
Elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea

name: Vieux Québec, petit loft ravissant
description: This unique accommodation located in the St-Jean-Baptiste neighborhood of Old Quebec is close to all sites and amenities, making it easy to plan your visit.
host_about:
Contemplatrice de la vie, de la nature, je demeure à Lévis, face au fleuve Saint-Laurent, un couloir emprunté par plusieurs oiseaux migrateurs.
J'aime partagé avec les gens de chez nous et de toute origine lorsque j'ai la chance. 
J'ai habité et exploré les environs de Montréal, du nord de l'Ontario et de la région de Toronto.
Vous découvrirez dans ma résidence, des souvenirs provenant de mes quelques voyages dans le monde.

Contemplating life, nature, I live in Lévis, facing the St. Lawrence River, a corridor used by several migratory birds.
I like sharing with people from home and from all backgrounds when I have the chance.
I lived and explored the surroundings of Montreal, northern Ontario and the Toronto area.
You will discover in my residence, memories from my few trips around the world.

What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

description:
Welcome to Le Central apartment, your spacious and bright haven of peace in the heart of the city. Located in a vibrant and trendy neighbourhood,

host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

name: P206 - Les Lofts St-Paul - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in patrimonial buildings dating from the 17th century on territories that have been inhabited by native peoples, Les Lofts St-Paul will transport you in an atmosphere true to the Québec City’s past.
In the heart of the Old Port of Québec, you will be able to wander day or night in its enchanting streets where you will find numerous authentic restaurants, shops and antique dealers offering you unforgettable culinary and artistic discoveries.
Only a few meters from the cruise terminal.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful sites of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street is one of the oldest commercial streets in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

description: Nestled in the hottest area of Quebec City, discover the charm of Vieux-Limoilou and its famous shopping boulevard, 3rd Avenue. You will have the opportunity to explore a multitude of the best restaurants and cafes Quebec has to offer! Limoilou is the most vibrant and lively area of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Limoilou is a charming and lively neighborhood with beautiful tree-lined streets and alleys where children play. There are old brick buildings with spiral stairs. It's a much-loved place for young families and entrepreneurs. Right now, the neighborhood is experiencing great vitality.
The street organization is similar to that of New York, with perpendicular streets and avenues. Walking on 3rd Avenue, between the 2nd and 16th Streets, we discover many attractive small shops: delicatessens, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea rooms, ice cream parlors... In summer, a part of 3rd Avenue is reserved for pedestrians.

description: Welcome to "El" Chico, located in the beautiful St-Roch district, on the 7th floor of an entirely new building! name: Limoilou/St-Roch
description: Located on the shoreline of the St-Charles River, apartment with parking (rare). It is the ideal place to visit Quebec City. You can live Limoilou and its 3rd with its many cafes. The St-Roch district and its famous Rue St-Joseph is also within walking distance. Those who want to enjoy the Quebec City Summer Festival to the fullest, you'll be in the right place. Only twenty minutes' walk to the historic part of Old Quebec fortified Quebec and Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: La3e ave is undoubtedly a must. For the bread box, the Smith house, the many shops. There is the possibility to visit the Stadaconé distillery 5 minutes from the house as well. If you cross the 3rd Ave bridge, you will have access to Rue St-Joseph, a street in demand. There is a shared bike station just next to the apartment and the bike path runs along the river. The 3 popular routes are the Montmorency waterfall (20 km round trip), the St-Charles River (9 km loop) and the Samuel de Champlain promenade, which goes to the Quebec City Bridge (20 km round trip).

name: SF403 - Lofts St-François - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in a freshly built establishment, this Loft is situated in a cultural, commercial and trendy district. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop patio. Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and more!
Elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea

neighborhood_overview:
Our loft is located in the vibrant Saint-Roch neighborhood, surrounded by trendy cafes, craft shops, and fine restaurants. Stroll the cobblestone streets and discover the hidden gems of this bustling neighborhood. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the center of Old Quebec with tons of amazing shopping, great restaurants, culture and history. Explore the oldest city in North America easily at any time of the year.

Walk score of 10. On the street adjacent to the building, there are multiple coffee shops, restaurants, a grocery store, a park, hardware store, boutiques and small shops. All within a short five minute walk or less.

Designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1985, Old Québec is the most intact fortified town north of Mexico, retaining its colonial architecture for over 400 years. It is the historic and cultural heart of Québec City, and the birthplace of French North America.

Walking distances:
2 minutes away from amazing views of the St Lawrence River
2 minutes away from Chateau Frontenac and Place d'Armes
2 minutes from Parc du Bastion-de-la-Reine
5 minutes away from Place Royal
8 minutes from Plaines d'Abraham
10 minutes from Parliament Hil

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview: The Saint-Sauveur neighborhood is a dynamic gem at the heart of Quebec City. Known for its vibrant and friendly vibe, this urban enclave offers a variety of local shops, delicious restaurants, and scenic cafes. Tree-lined streets invite you to walk, while parks offer green spaces to relax. Street art and cultural events animate the streets, creating a unique artistic atmosphere. With a lively nightlife and a warm community, Saint-Sauveur is the perfect place to experience the hustle and bustle of Quebec City.

description:

host_about:
Chers futurs guests,

J’adore voyager et je suis donc souvent absent. À mes yeux la meilleure façon de découvrir une ville est en y vivant comme quelqu’un de local et cela passe, bien entendu, par le logement. C’est dans cette optique que lors de mes voyages je laisse mon logement à disposition des voyageurs du monde entier, alors : pourquoi pas vous ?  :)

Pas d’inquiétude, même si je ne suis pas présent lors de vos réservations, Exode Bnb, à laquelle j’ai confié la gestion de mon logement, saura rendre votre séjour aussi agréable que possible !

A très vite,

David.

Dear future guests,

I love travelling, so I’m often absent. For me, the best way to get to know a city is by living there like a local person, and this can only be done, of course, by getting accommodation. It is with this in mind that whenever I am travelling, I make my lodging facility available to travelers from around the world, so: why not you?

Don’t worry, even if I’m not present when you are doing the booking arrangement, Exode Bnb, to whom I have entrusted the management of my home, will make your stay as enjoyable as possible!

See you soon,

David.

host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

neighborhood_overview:
Like Griffintown in Montreal or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, the Saint-Roch neighborhood has gone from working-class neighborhood to sought-after place in a few years. Food, culture, technology, fashion, nightlife: discover the Lower Town of Quebec City at its most fashionable!

Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The hand is now regaining its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To do the trendy shops, eat in the last restaurant everyone talks about, sip a drink in a pub, or watch the most popular show of the moment, we're going to Saint-Roch! In summer, Rue Saint-Joseph is exclusively pedestrianized on weekends.

The area is particularly popular with foodies: excellent tables adjoin small neighborhood restaurants where you can eat well at a very good price, while microbreweries have the wind in their sails and brew refreshing original beers. Do not forget to visit a delicatessen to bring the local terroir home!

host_about:
Chers futurs guests,

J’adore voyager et je suis donc souvent absent. À mes yeux la meilleure façon de découvrir une ville est en y vivant comme quelqu’un de local et cela passe, bien entendu, par le logement. C’est dans cette optique que lors de mes voyages je laisse mon logement à disposition des voyageurs du monde entier, alors : pourquoi pas vous ?  :)

Pas d’inquiétude, même si je ne suis pas présent lors de vos réservations, Exode Bnb, à laquelle j’ai confié la gestion de mon logement, saura rendre votre séjour aussi agréable que possible !

A très vite,

David.

Dear future guests,

I love travelling, so I’m often absent. For me, the best way to get to know a city is by living there like a local person, and this can only be done, of course, by getting accommodation. It is with this in mind that whenever I am travelling, I make my lodging facility available to travelers from around the world, so: why not you?

Don’t worry, even if I’m not present when you are doing the booking arrangement, Exode Bnb, to whom I have entrusted the management of my home, will make your stay as enjoyable as possible!

See you soon,

David.

description:
You'll stay in the city's most pleasant area! You are close to several shops such as cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacies, clothes, etc. If you want to live with locals and see how Quebecers live, while being a 5-minute walk from the fortifications, this is the place!

neighborhood_overview:
You are close to these sectors:
1. The old fortifications located in the Upper Town: This is the neighborhood everyone will visit. At first, the fortifications were for protection from the English, now it's to keep tourists inside;) Anyway, this neighborhood is super beautiful, you'll love it. On the other hand, this is mainly for tourism. You can buy a "J 'AIME LE QUÉBEC" t-shirt.

2. Le Faubourg St-Jean-Baptiste which is right next to the fortifications: This neighborhood is mine and soon yours, even if you don't choose my place. I would highly recommend this neighborhood. Here, you'll live with the locals. St. John Street is a beautiful street for St. John Street where you'll find everything you need without even using your car. This street will take you straight into the fortifications which are a 10-minute walk from your home.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Quebec City, a city rich in history, culture and charm! Here's a local guide to help you discover the best places to visit and the must-see activities to do: Old Quebec: Plunge into history by exploring the cobblestone streets of Old Quebec. Visit the famous Château Frontenac, stroll along the ramparts, and discover Place Royale. The Citadel of Quebec City: Take in the panoramic view of the city from this historic fortress. Join the changing of the Guards and learn about the military history of the area. Le Quartier Petit-Champlain: Explore one of the city's most picturesque areas, with charming shops, art galleries, and inviting restaurants. La Terrasse Dufferin: Stroll along this walk overlooking the St. Lawrence River. Enjoy street artists, sculptures, and stunning river views. The Museum of Francophone America: Immerse yourself in the cultural history of the region and learn about the evolution of the French language in North America. Promenade Samuel-De Champlain: Enjoy

The apartment is perfectly located in the heart of Old Quebec, a 5-minute walk from all popular tourist sites. The fully renovated apartment is located in a heritage house of 1844.

This is a 2 1/2 composed of an open plan kitchen/bedroom with a queen bed. The living room has a work desk and a sofa bed (double) for two extra people. A laundry is a 1-minute walk away.

Contact us for bespoke availability or any questions!

description:

Our charming apartment located in the heart of downtown Quebec City, a lively neighborhood offering a multitude of cafes, bars, restaurants and public transportation options. Just minutes from the old town, our privileged location allows you to take full advantage of the city's energy.

name: La 3016 Mallet
description: Built in 1927, this magnificent English style building with 3 floors is surrounded by mature trees. It used to host foreign engineers of the pulp and paper company Abitibi-Price in Beaupré. These employees were mostly originally from Ontario and England. This incredible “Staff House”, by the Sainte-Anne-du-Nord river, was used mostly as accommodation for the staff as well as visiting company guests.

name: Le Renard
description:
Welcome to our urban condo which offers you an exceptional stay experience. This elegant, well-equipped condo is the ideal place to experience all that Quebec City has to offer.

Perfect for 2 to 4 people, or a small family, you will be seduced by the scenery and comfort of the Fox. With its large fenestration that floods the living room with natural light and its pretty balcony, the Renard offers you a picturesque view of the surroundings in the heart of the St-Roch district.
host_about:
Bonjour à vous!

Nous sommes Émilie, Dominic, Lauriane et Philippe et nous sommes les North Travelers. Nous sommes deux couples d'amis qui, après avoir fait un voyage en Europe, sommes tombés en amour avec les logements de type Airbnb! Nous avons construit de nombreux souvenirs et avons adoré le fait de pouvoir avoir le confort d'une maison au prix d'une chambre d'hôtel! Voulant partager cette expérience au Québec, nous nous sommes lancés dans l'aventure de devenir des hôtes Airbnb! Il nous fera plaisir de vous accueillir dans ce logement qui, nous l'espérons, vous fera sentir comme à la maison! Au plaisir et bon séjour! :)

name: Urban and Historic Loft | Grande-Allée | Old Qc
description: This loft is equipped with a fully fitted kitchen, including a refrigerator, stove, microwave oven, dishwasher, pressure coffee maker, and electric blender. neighborhood_overview:
Grande-Allée:

Nicknamed the Champs Élysées of Quebec, Grande-Allée is famous for its numerous restaurants, bars, and terraces. It’s a nightlife hub where one can find legendary establishments such as:

Le Patio du Festibière: A new festive & casual bar on Grande-Allée. A typically local spot that’s unpretentious with an unmatched atmosphere! THE place for those who love to enjoy the best of summer all year round!
Le Dagobert: A historic multi-story nightclub.
Les Voûtes de Napoléon: A singer-songwriter bar to enjoy Quebec folk music.
L’Atelier: A chic restaurant-bar known for its mixology.
Faite à l’os: Master of the grill, Faite à l’os offers the typical American barbecue experience.
Plains of Abraham:

A historic site that was the scene of the battle between the French and the English in 1759. Today, it’s a large park where one can stroll, picnic, and enjoy cultural events.

name: The Caiman's Nest | Parking | Pool | BBQ | WIFI
description:
Come and discover this peaceful haven ideally located in the Saint-Roch neighborhood of Quebec City, perfect for exploring the city in tranquility!

✯ Parking space provided
✯ A cozy bedroom with a queen-size bed
✯ A living room equipped with a high-definition smart television and a sofa bed for cozy evenings after a day of exploration
✯ A fully equipped kitchen allowing you to prepare anything you desire
✯ A washer-dryer combo
✯ A modern and inviting bathroom
neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch stands out for its trendy atmosphere, offering a plethora of small restaurants, cafes, and lively bars. Its streets are lined with shops offering a variety of products, from clothing to household items to toys, especially along Saint-Joseph Street. Additionally, the neighborhood is punctuated with concert halls, theaters, and contemporary art galleries, adding to its cultural dynamism.

The natural allure of the neighborhood is enhanced by the Jean-Paul-L'Allier Garden, where an artificial waterfall provides a peaceful setting. Furthermore, the imposing Saint-Roch church stands nearby, bearing witness to the region's architectural heritage.

✩ Close to the famous Quebec Christmas Boutique (15 minutes on foot)
✩ The Quebec Citadel is a 6-minute drive away
✩ The enchanting Old Quebec neighborhood and its cobblestone streets are a 15-minute walk away
✩ Montmorency Falls is a 13-minute drive away

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview:
''What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go! In summer, rue Saint-Joseph converts into a pedestrian-only street every weekend.
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you! ''

Source: Destination Québec Cité / St-Roch neighbourhood

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Limoilou, a vibrant neighborhood in Quebec City where authenticity meets modernity.

Limoilou is known for its varied culinary scene, from small bistros to gourmet restaurants, to craft breweries.

It is also a place rich in culture, with the Maison de la culture Félix-Leclerc and the Théâtre Premier Acte offering artistic events and shows.

To enjoy nature, Parc Cartier-Brébeuf offers green spaces ideal for relaxing or taking a stroll along the Saint-Charles River.

In short, Limoilou is a concentrate of urban life, art, gastronomy and nature to discover during your stay in Quebec City.

host_about:
Contemplatrice de la vie, de la nature, je demeure à Lévis, face au fleuve Saint-Laurent, un couloir emprunté par plusieurs oiseaux migrateurs.
J'aime partagé avec les gens de chez nous et de toute origine lorsque j'ai la chance. 
J'ai habité et exploré les environs de Montréal, du nord de l'Ontario et de la région de Toronto.
Vous découvrirez dans ma résidence, des souvenirs provenant de mes quelques voyages dans le monde.

Contemplating life, nature, I live in Lévis, facing the St. Lawrence River, a corridor used by several migratory birds.
I like sharing with people from home and from all backgrounds when I have the chance.
I lived and explored the surroundings of Montreal, northern Ontario and the Toronto area.
You will discover in my residence, memories from my few trips around the world.

name: Magnifique maison de ville dans le Vieux-Québec!
description: Our townhouse is perfect for a group of friends, family or workers. Conveniently located, you will be within minutes walking of the most wonderful attractions of Old Quebec. The famous Château Frontenac, the festive Rue Saint-Jean, the Plains of Abraham, the turbulent Grande Allée and much more.
neighborhood_overview:
Quebec City is divided into three main areas:
Downtown, commonly called "la Basse-Ville": When you stay in this area, you need to go up to the Haute-Ville.
Upper Town includes Old Quebec and Le Faubourg St-Jean-Baptiste:
Old Quebec with its old fortifications. This is the neighborhood everyone will visit. Formerly, the fortifications were used to protect themselves from the English, now it's to keep tourists inside;) In short, this area is superb, you'll love it. It is mainly for tourism. You can buy an "I LOVE QUÉBEC" t-shirt and other souvenirs in the many shops there.
The Faubourg Saint-Jean-Baptiste is next to the fortifications. And this is where my property is located. Here, you'll live with the locals. Rue Saint-Jean is a beautiful shopping street where you can walk and enjoy the lively atmosphere. This street will take you straight into the fortifications, a 5-minute walk from your home.

name: At Napoleon's | In the heart of old Quebec City
description:
Visit Old Quebec and stay in a historic building that was a printing press in the early 1900s, then an office space for architects after the 1980s.

In the heart of Old Quebec, all historical sites are within walking distance (Château Frontenac, Terrasse Dufferin, Place Royale, Notre-Dame-des-Anges, Plains of Abraham, and more).

We are surrounded by some of the best restaurants in Quebec City.
neighborhood_overview: We are in the main historic district of Quebec City, on a street with many art galleries, restaurants and pretty shops. About a 2-minute walk from the funicular, you'll reach Château Frontenac and Terrace Dufferin in no time. The hotel has 10 uniquely designed, Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. Double suites sleep up to 4 guests. All the rooms have private shower-only bathrooms.

name: Initial | 303 | Québec
description: You will appreciate this low-cost accommodation, centrally located and comfortable for 4 people.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and conveniently located. There is a park 50 m away and close to the apartment you will find several restaurants, bars and cafes.   You will also be close to the historic district, the small champlain, tourist attractions and shops.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: M11 | Le Cavalier - Vintage 1 bed in Old Québec
description: Nestled in the heart of Old Quebec City, the Cavalier Du Moulin offers timeless charm and elegance. This vintage hotel features beautifully restored rooms with classic decor and stunning views of cobblestone streets. Guests can enjoy  complimentary coffee and tea steps away from Quebec's old town's best spots. With nearby attractions like the iconic Château Frontenac and vibrant shops, this hotel provides an enchanting retreat for travellers seeking a taste of Quebec’s rich history.
neighborhood_overview: Quebec City, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a stunning blend of history and culture. Its Old Town, known as Vieux-Québec, features cobblestone streets, charming boutiques, and centuries-old architecture, including the iconic Château Frontenac. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Citadel and Place Royale, as well as enjoy vibrant festivals and local cuisine. With its European flair and rich heritage, Old Town Quebec City offers a captivating experience that transports you back in time, making it a must-visit destination.

name: Lumineux appartement dans le Vieux Limoilou.
description: Located in the most "trendy" neighborhood of Quebec City, come and live Vieux-Limoilou and its famous commercial artery, 3rd Avenue. Here you will find several of the best restaurants and coffee shops in Quebec City! Limoilou is the city's most crowded area.
neighborhood_overview:
Limoilou is a charming and lively neighborhood with beautiful tree-lined streets and alleys where children play. There are old brick buildings with spiral stairs. It's a much-loved place for young families and entrepreneurs. Right now, the neighborhood is experiencing great vitality.
The street organization is similar to that of New York, with perpendicular streets and avenues. Walking on 3rd Avenue, between the 2nd and 16th Streets, we discover many attractive small shops: delicatessens, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea rooms, ice cream parlors... In summer, a part of 3rd Avenue is reserved for pedestrians.

neighborhood_overview: On the edge of the Saint-Roch and Saint-Sauveur districts, animated by a host of neighborhood shops, shopping streets where cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bars and local shops. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

The Antique Cat in Beauport is an ideal resort for tourists looking to discover the Quebec City area. This address is close to several tourist attractions, activities and restaurants to meet everyone's desires.

Among the must-sees in the area, the Parc de la Chute-Montmorency is a majestic natural site only 10 minutes drive from the address. This 83-meter high waterfall offers breathtaking views of the St. Lawrence River and offers many activities such as ziplining, via ferrata and descent as a reminder.

For lovers of history and culture, Old Quebec is a gem to discover. It is about a 20-minute drive from the address and offers unique architecture, fascinating history, and refined gastronomy. The Château Frontenac, the Museum of Civilization and the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Québec are some of the must-see attractions.

Athletes will not be left behind with the activities offered nearby such as golf, hiking, skiing, snowmobiling and fishing. Mont-Sainte-

neighborhood_overview:
We live in a charming, residential, quiet, safe and easy access area by highways. The historic Charlesbourg quarter, the only star village in North America! Residential area with green park and free music shows in summer. Guided tour of the neighborhood, activities at the Jesuit mill (first mill to establish the seigneury), café - croissant, craft shop and Quebec designer, favorite chocolate, fudgerie, massage therapy and library less than 5 minutes walk.
Less than 15 minutes (car) from the Galeries de la Capitale with its IMAX cinema and indoor skating rink, Beauport Lake and Wendake (Huron-Wendate Aboriginal community), its museum and excellent gastronomic menu.
10 minutes by bus (direct) from Old Quebec and the Plains of Abraham.
host_about: Maman de deux ados, j'aime beaucoup le jardinage !  J'aime les langues et les cultures, j'aime voyager et j'aime recevoir ! Bienvenue chez moi !

name: Initial | Époque | Ville de Québec
description:
Perfectly located in the heart of the Saint-Jean-Baptiste District, this grand 5-bedroom apartment also offers a huge kitchen for gathering.

Located just steps from the beginnings, attractions, old Quebec, highways and urban life, this apartment certainly has something to make your stay in Quebec memorable.

Rental + 90 days (full month)
neighborhood_overview:
"The Saint-Jean-Baptiste district awaits you!
Come and discover a neighborhood in the heart of Quebec City. Meet warm, authentic, endearing, and passionate people. Discover the richness of its history, architecture, and attractions and be seduced by its artisans.

Fins palaces and gourmands, you have a meeting with the flavors of the Saint-Jean-Baptiste district! Give birth to an afternoon craving in the artisanal shops and delicatessens that are famous for the Faubourg. Share a moment with friends at its friendly bars where locals gather in a friendly way. Discover the many multiethnic restaurants that open their doors.

Come entertain, dance, and watch all kinds of shows in the local bars, pubs, bistros, and cabarets. Under the flakes and hot season, treat yourself to the original boutiques that the neighborhood has to offer: handmade items, import products, and a variety of creations. Visit unique clothing, shoe, and accessory shops in Quebec City.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

host_about:
Garçon sympathique et ouvert d'esprit, aime la vie simple et pas compliquée. J'aime le camping, la petite chasse et la pêche, la grande forêt, les rivières sauvages. Mais j'aime aussi ma vie d'urbain: bon restos, bons vins, bon livres. Et voyager, bien sûr. Jusqu'à maintenant j'ai vu l'Europe, l'Inde et l'Amérique du Sud. Je suis agent de recherche au gouvernement du Québec.


Friendly and openminded guy, I like the simple and uncomplicated life. I love camping, hunting and fishing , large forests, wild rivers. But I also like my urban life: good restaurants, good wine  good books. And travel, of course. Until now I have seen Europe, India  and South America. I'm a research agent for the Quebec government.

neighborhood_overview:
The historic district of Beauport, decreed in 1964 and enlarged in 1985, covers a formerly rural territory of about 96 hectares. It covers nearly six kilometers and crosses the old municipalities of Giffard, Beauport, Villeneuve and Courville. The area is bounded to the west by Rue des Martyrs, and to the east, by the junction of Avenue Royale and Boulevard des Chutes.

The historic district occupies the Beauport coastline, formed of terraces offering panoramas of the St-Lawrence River and Orleans Island. It has over 650 buildings of residential and contemporary character, which are a testament to architecture from the 18th to 20th century. The majority of these buildings are situated along the winding, upward route from west to west, formed by the Royal Road and Royal Avenue. Secondary streets, which are oblique with the main road, are reminiscent of the orientation of the initial plots.

The historic district is located in the Beauport municipal district of Quebec

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview:
St-Roch is a vibrant and dynamic neighborhood located in the heart of Quebec City. Known for its trendy atmosphere and lively streets, St-Roch offers a unique blend of history, culture, and modernity. Here's what you can expect:

-Cultural Hub: St-Roch is a thriving cultural hub, with numerous art galleries, theaters, and cultural centers. It is home to innovative artists, musicians, and performers, making it a hub for creativity and artistic expression.

-Trendy Cafés and Restaurants: The neighborhood is renowned for its diverse culinary scene. From cozy coffee shops to trendy eateries, St-Roch offers a wide range of dining options. You'll find everything from international cuisine to local delicacies, as well as trendy bars and breweries.

-Boutique Shopping: St-Roch is a haven for shoppers looking for unique and independent boutiques. The neighborhood is filled with trendy fashion stores, local artisans, and specialty shops offering a variety of product

neighborhood_overview: Saint-Roch is animated by a host of local shops, a commercial street where cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bar and local shops coexist. The area is a few minutes' walk from the Historic Quarter of Old Québec, the Old Port of Québec and the Train Station.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview:
When searching for a condo as an investment, we were looking for the perfect spot with a minimum of maintenance to do. Something close to the city with a specific local vibe. So when we heard about the Kameleon project, we knew right away that this would be the perfect place to welcome guests from all over the world! Close enough to the Old City but in a district that have all the best restaurants to discover. Foodies you will not be disappointed! You can also take a culinary tour that occurs in the same street as the Modern Cocoon. You can easily walk to rue St-Joseph and discover all this vibrant street has to offer. We as locals, often go to theese very close by restaurants: Kraken cru ( seafood) Batutto (voted top 10 best new Canadian restaurant) l’Affaire est Ketshup, la Champagnerie ( large champagne selection)
and also le Clocher Penché ( French Bistrot ) And if you want to enjoy a delicious poutine Le Coin de la Patate is just beside!
host_about: J’adore voyager! En tant qu’invité ce que j’aime est de m’imprégner de la culture locale de l’endroit. Donc en tant qu’hôte nous souhaitons faire vivre la même expérience à nos invités. C’est pourquoi nos propriétés sont choisies méticuleusement selon la localisation, la qualité de l’hébergement et l’expérience globale.
